page.title: 02DOWNHAM SCHOOL FOR DISABLED
page.content: Downham{School}was opened in 1963. There are 70 pupils; 14 of these stay overnight in the{school hostel.}The children start full time from about 4 years old. The teachers aim to prepare the children for the outside world. When the children leave school they are either 16 or, if the{teachers}and parents think the child would benefit from another three years of schooling, they stay on until 19. They usually go on to an adult{training centre.}Taxis, minibuses and parents' cars are used to transport the children to and from school. The main{disabilities}are spina bifida, mongolism and brain damage. The school has its own scout group, youth club and a heated pool in a fibreglass dome. It is a very happy place with everyone very friendly.
